department_name: Department of Architecture and Physical Planning

courses.name: Bachelor of Architecture
courses.description: This program prepares students to design buildings and other physical structures, with focus on aesthetic design, functional planning, and structural integrity.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio I
course_units.description: Introduction to design principles and architectural drawing.

course_units.title: History of Architecture I
course_units.description: Survey of architectural developments from ancient to medieval times.

course_units.title: Building Materials
course_units.description: Properties and applications of common building materials.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio II
course_units.description: Design projects with emphasis on spatial relationships.

course_units.title: History of Architecture II
course_units.description: Architectural developments from the Renaissance to modern era.

course_units.title: Building Structures I
course_units.description: Basic structural principles and mechanics.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio III
course_units.description: Integration of functional and aesthetic concerns in design.

course_units.title: Building Services I
course_units.description: Fundamentals of building utilities and services.

course_units.title: Building Structures II
course_units.description: Advanced structural systems for buildings.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio IV
course_units.description: Design projects emphasizing environmental considerations.

course_units.title: Computer-Aided Design
course_units.description: Digital tools and techniques for architectural design.

course_units.title: Building Services II
course_units.description: Advanced building systems and services integration.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio V
course_units.description: Complex design projects with urban considerations.

course_units.title: Theory of Architecture
course_units.description: Critical thinking and theoretical frameworks in architecture.

course_units.title: Building Economics
course_units.description: Cost considerations in architectural projects.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio VI
course_units.description: Integration of technical systems in architectural design.

course_units.title: Urban Planning
course_units.description: Principles and practices of urban planning and design.

course_units.title: Landscape Architecture
course_units.description: Principles of landscape design integrated with architecture.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio VII
course_units.description: Comprehensive design project with multiple factors.

course_units.title: Professional Practice I
course_units.description: Legal and ethical aspects of architectural practice.

course_units.title: Sustainable Architecture
course_units.description: Environmentally responsive design strategies.

course_units.title: Architectural Design Studio VIII
course_units.description: Advanced design project with urban and cultural context.

course_units.title: Building Conservation
course_units.description: Preservation and adaptive reuse of historic buildings.

course_units.title: Professional Practice II
course_units.description: Project management and office procedures.

course_units.title: Architectural Thesis I
course_units.description: Independent research and design proposal.

course_units.title: Advanced Building Technology
course_units.description: Cutting-edge technologies in building construction.

course_units.title: Contemporary Architectural Theories
course_units.description: Current theoretical discourse in architecture.

course_units.title: Architectural Thesis II
course_units.description: Final thesis design project and documentation.

course_units.title: Professional Internship
course_units.description: Supervised practical experience in architecture firm.

course_units.title: Building Performance Evaluation
course_units.description: Assessment of completed buildings for performance.

courses.name: Bachelor of Science in Physical Planning
courses.description: This program focuses on planning and designing communities, urban areas, and regions with consideration for social, economic, and environmental factors.

course_units.title: Introduction to Physical Planning
course_units.description: Overview of physical planning principles and practices.

course_units.title: History of Urban Development
course_units.description: Historical evolution of cities and urban forms.

course_units.title: Drawing and Visualization
course_units.description: Graphical communication for planning and design.

course_units.title: Planning Theory
course_units.description: Theoretical frameworks in urban and regional planning.

course_units.title: Introduction to GIS
course_units.description: Geographic Information Systems for planning applications.

course_units.title: Sociology for Planners
course_units.description: Social dynamics and processes in urban environments.

course_units.title: Planning Studio I
course_units.description: Basic planning exercises and site analysis.

course_units.title: Urban Infrastructure Planning
course_units.description: Planning for utilities, transportation, and public facilities.

course_units.title: Planning Law and Regulations
course_units.description: Legal frameworks governing physical planning.

course_units.title: Planning Studio II
course_units.description: Neighborhood and community planning projects.

course_units.title: Urban Economics
course_units.description: Economic principles applied to urban development and land use.

course_units.title: Environmental Planning
course_units.description: Integration of environmental considerations in planning.

course_units.title: Planning Studio III
course_units.description: Urban planning and design projects.

course_units.title: Transportation Planning
course_units.description: Planning for urban mobility and transportation systems.

course_units.title: Urban Renewal and Regeneration
course_units.description: Strategies for revitalizing urban areas.

course_units.title: Planning Studio IV
course_units.description: Regional and metropolitan planning projects.

course_units.title: Housing and Community Development
course_units.description: Planning for residential areas and communities.

course_units.title: Advanced GIS for Planning
course_units.description: Advanced spatial analysis for planning applications.

course_units.title: Planning Studio V
course_units.description: Comprehensive planning project.

course_units.title: Planning Research Methods
course_units.description: Research methodologies for planning studies.

course_units.title: Sustainable Urban Development
course_units.description: Planning for sustainable cities and regions.

course_units.title: Planning Thesis
course_units.description: Independent research and planning project.

course_units.title: Professional Planning Practice
course_units.description: Professional and ethical aspects of planning practice.

course_units.title: Contemporary Planning Issues
course_units.description: Current challenges and innovations in planning.
